Document: A Framework for Mitigating Malicious RLHF Feedback in LLM Training Using Consensus-Based Reward.pdf
Contributions: Proposes COBRA consensus framework (RoT/DRWA/AVGA) to mitigate malicious RLHF feedback.
Experiments / Data: SST-2 sentiment analysis (DistilBERT) and Anthropic/hh-rlhf for conversational RLHF under mixed-trust scenarios.
Metrics: Reward accuracy (e.g., 85% vs 48.78% unprotected), LLM accuracy, AUC mentioned.
Limitations / Notes: Uses synthetic feedback; human intent variable not explored; future work listed.

Document: Agent4FaceForgery - Multi-Agent LLM Framework for Realistic Face Forgery Detection (arXiv 2509.12546v1).pdf
Contributions: Multi-agent simulation of forger intent/process to generate realistic training data; improves generalization.
Experiments / Data: Train on FF++; evaluate on Celeb-DF (V2), DFDC, WildDeepfake, DFD; cross-dataset evaluation.
Metrics: AUC, AP, EER, accuracy; annotation quality precision/recall/F1.
Limitations / Notes: Notes limitations of single-LLM approaches; explicit limitations not deeply detailed.

Document: Beyond PRNU - Learning Robust Device-Specific Fingerprint for Source Camera Identification.pdf
Contributions: Proposes low/mid-frequency device-specific fingerprint beyond PRNU; addresses spatial sync fragility.
Experiments / Data: VISION, Warwick, Daxing, UNISA2020, custom dataset; open-set validation.
Metrics: Identification accuracy; PCE for PRNU removal.
Limitations / Notes: Discusses PRNU and CNN weaknesses; explicit limitations for proposed method are limited.

Document: ForenX - Towards Explainable AI-Generated Image Detection with Multimodal Large Language Models (arXiv 2508.01402v1).pdf
Contributions: ForenX for explainable AI-generated image detection; introduces ForgReason dataset for explanations.
Experiments / Data: GenImage/ForenSynths; SD3/Flux samples; human-annotated explanation data.
Metrics: Mean accuracy (mAcc); cross-source generalization; explanation metrics (comprehensiveness, relevance, similarity, reasonableness).
Limitations / Notes: Explanation completeness issues; ForgReason improvements noted as future work.

Document: Fourier-VLM - Compressing Vision Tokens in the Frequency Domain for Large Vision-Language Models (arXiv 2508.06038v2).pdf
Contributions: Frequency-domain vision token compression for VLM efficiency.
Experiments / Data: LLaVA-v1.5 setup; VQAv2, GQA, SciQA, VQAT, POPE, MMBench, LLaVAW, MMMU.
Metrics: Average accuracy across image benchmarks (>96% average reported).
Limitations / Notes: Calls for more generalizable compression strategies; limited explicit limitation detail.

Document: From Black Boxes to Glass Boxes - Explainable AI for Trustworthy Deepfake Forensics.pdf
Contributions: Survey of explainable deepfake forensics; methods, metrics, datasets.
Metrics: Discusses Accuracy/AUC/EER and XAI evaluation frameworks.
Limitations / Notes: Highlights opacity limits of black-box models and sensor-trace methods.

Document: From Evidence to Verdict - An Agent-Based Forensic Framework for AI-Generated Image Detection (arXiv 2511.00181v1).pdf
Contributions: AIFo: training-free agentic forensics with evidence gathering and debate.
Experiments / Data: 6,000-image benchmark (in-the-wild + benchmarks); external evidence (EXIF, reverse search).
Limitations / Notes: Memory module excluded from evaluation due to label-dependence at test time.

Document: LLM-driven Provenance Forensics for Threat Investigation and Detection (arXiv 2508.21323v2).pdf
Contributions: PROVSEEK: LLM-agent framework for provenance-based forensics.
Limitations / Notes: LLM extraction and orchestration limitations noted.

Document: MAD-Sherlock - Multi-Agent Debate for Visual Misinformation Detection (arXiv 2410.20140v2).pdf
Contributions: Multi-agent debate with external retrieval for OOC image-text misinformation detection.
Limitations / Notes: Dependent on external retrieval; textual-only explanations; English data bias; open-source adversarial risk.

Document: MAD-Sherlock - Multi-Agent Debate for Visual Misinformation Detection.pdf
On the Reliability of Vision-Language Models Under Adversarial Frequency-Domain Perturbations (arXiv 2507.22398v3).pdf
Contributions: Shows VLM vulnerability to frequency-domain perturbations; introduces RGFreq dataset.
Experiments / Data: SD3.5/SD1.5 ImageNet, StableImageNet-1K, CIFAKE, GCC, COCO; multiple VLMs.
Metrics: Realism score distributions, semantic drift, caption length changes.
Limitations / Notes: High cost to generate optimal perturbations; larger models add overhead.

Document: PRNU Estimation Based on Weighted Averaging for Source Smartphone Video Identification.pdf
Contributions: Weighted averaging PRNU estimation for smartphone videos.

Document: Towards Explainable Fake Image Detection with Multi-Modal Large Language Models (arXiv 2504.14245v2).pdf
Contributions: MLLM-based explainable fake image detection; prompt fusion strategies.
Experiments / Data: MMFR dataset (GPT-4o + expert annotation); Midjourney/DALL-E referenced.
Limitations / Notes: Limitations section emphasizes ethics/transparency; technical limits are not detailed.

Document: 5 Real-World Ways to Optimize Prompt Engineering for Smarter LLM Outputs _ by Pratik Abnave _ Medium.html
Contributions: Prompt engineering tips and workflow guidance.
Limitations / Notes: Practical advice only; no quantitative evaluation.

Document: How LLMs Are Transforming Image to Text Analysis with AI _ by Amol Walunj _ Medium.html
Contributions: Overview of LLM-based image-to-text, OCR limits.
Experiments / Data: Informal comparison of Gemini 1.5 Pro/2.0 Flash.
Limitations / Notes: Notes OCR accuracy/efficiency limitations; no formal metrics.

Document: Large Language Models in Digital Forensics _ by Aastha Thakker _ Medium.html
Contributions: Overview of LLMs in digital forensics and challenges.
Overview of MAD strategies and applications.

Document: Unmasking Deepfakes_ How You and AI Agents Can Detect Them _ by Ross W. Green, MD (CustomAI Studio) _ Medium.html
Contributions: General overview of deepfake detection and agent collaboration.
Limitations / Notes: Notes accuracy vs false positive/negative trade-offs.
